page.title: 19Alyn Valley: Recreation
page.content: The scenic countryside here attracts nature-lovers and ramblers from places within easy travelling distance. One of the best walks is 'The Leete', a footpath along the River Alyn between Loggerheads and Rhydymwyn. The Leete was originally constructed in the 19th century as a channel to take water from the river to power water-wheels at lead-mines in the Alyn Gorge:now it provides an attractive woodland path starting at Loggerheads on the river- bank, and further down the valley becoming a ledge cut into the steep valley side. A spectacular spot on The Leete is 'Devil's Gorge', where a narrow footbridge carries the path over the rocky chasm of an old calcite mine. The rock-faces here are used by climbers for abseiling, while the caves and disused mines nearby provide interest for cavers.
